blog.name: silkygoldmilkweed
blog.title: sansa stark & sandor clegane are soulmates

summary: I do not know what it means but I think it’s interesting that some of Sandor’s important early interactions with Sansa are by...
body:
I do not know what it means but I think it’s interesting that some of Sandor’s important early interactions with Sansa are by command.

Like someone vaguely shouts that the Stark girl needs something and Sandor is like “MEEEE ME me me I’ll do it! I’ve got this.”

* Joff: “Clean her up she’s messy.” Sandor’s there with the handkerchief!

* Tyrion: “Give the girl something to cover herself with.” Sandor’s at your service with a cloak.

* Tyrion: “Someone go and find the Stark girl!” The Hound already read your mind, my lord.

He needs less than a nudge to pay attention to her and put himself in her service.

And/or everyone else in her world outsources her care?

blog.name: winterfellchild
blog.title: The pack survives
blog.description:
"She (Daenerys) has the power to destroy, she can wipe out entire cities, and we
certainly see that in ‘Fire and Blood.’ We see the dragons wiping out 
entire armies, wiping out towns and cities, destroying them, but that 
doesn’t necessarily enable you to rule — it just enables you to destroy." GRRM

tags: braiding her hair is not what I want to see
the worst characters in this story tried to break her
not to be a maid to the qUeEn
she is the lady of Winterfell ffs
summary: Hey if they are hyping sansa not happy with d with the usual got hype doesn’t that mean they’ll actually get on? They always do...
question: Hey if they are hyping sansa not happy with d with the usual got hype doesn’t that mean they’ll actually get on? They always do the opposite
answer:
Normally, I would agree with you anon but I noticed that when it comes to Sansa this fandom is always so strange.

And in fact, the fandom doesn’t really believe that Sansa not liking Dænerys will be a problem for the rightful qUeEn… no matter how many hints HBO is giving them.

All I read in the last months is:

it doesn’t matter if Sansa won’t like Dænerys because 1) it won’t last long since she will love Dænerys soon enough like everyone else and 2) Sansa’s opinion is not important because the AOTD is coming and that’s the only thing that matters now or it’s not important because Jon and/or Arya will protect Dænerys from Sansa evil manipulations.

So you see, it’s not important how much they are hyping this fact because it’s not a real problem.

Sansa understandable reasons for not liking Dænerys are not even considered in some parts of the fandom… for them the highlight of Sansa’s storyline in season 8 will be to braid Dænerys’ hair.

Surviving Joffrey, Cersei, Ramsay and Littlefinger in 7 seasons of GoT just to braid Dænerys’ hair… I can’t wait to see it 🤮

summary:
Fun things about Sansa
- She writes poetry, what a romantic
- She is a huge history nerd
- She seems to remember little facts...
body:
Fun things about Sansa


- She writes poetry, what a romantic

- She is a huge history nerd

- She seems to remember little facts about everyone

- She paractises two religions

- She loves to lock herself up with sweets and a good book

- People like her quickly, even when she was a hostage

- She is very erger to learn

- She loves fairytales

- She can guess peoples identities by their age and the house they belong to. Talk about using knowledge!

- She enjoys hunting with falcons, very unladylike

- She is currently running a household and organizing a tourney at age 13

- She can play the basics of multiple instruments

- She has a lovely singing voice



Feel free to add things, lets make this a long list!

blog.name: cutlike-a-buffalo
blog.title: Never for money, always for love.

summary: Most of the Jaime/Brienne scenes are parallels to the Jonsa ones. They are shot almost the same way, their arguments, the sighs,...
body: Most of the Jaime/Brienne scenes are parallels to the Jonsa ones. They are shot almost the same way, their arguments, the sighs, the longing gazes, they gave each others presents, the physical contact, their goodbyes. That scene where Brienne tells Jaime to take Riverrun without blood shed they are arguing about politics and in the end Jaime listens to Brienne. The scene where Brienne grabs Jaime in s7 is almost the same as Jonsa’s. Both men are with other women. Jaime has been in love with Cersei for so long and gone too far for her that he can’t admit his feelings for Brienne, that would cause chaos. Jon’s priority is the war to come, he is Sansa’s “half brother” so he can’t admit his feelings because that would cause chaos. People say Brienne and Jaime are so romantic but they can’t see Jonsa?? They even had a long forhead kiss and serious eye-fucking, lip staring. And the parallels are not just Jaime/Brienne but also Ned/Cat Robb/Talisa. Why would they shoot their scenes almost the same way If it doesn’t mean anything? I think that in Jonsa at least one of them is in love.

title: Snowflakes
body:
Written for @jonsadrabbles day 3: Modern AU OR Snowflakes

Jon is a king now, which means he has duties and meetings to attend. But when the snow falls, Sansa just wants to built a snowman

Canon Divergence // Canon Compliant 

The cold wind screamed when it whirled around the castle. It creeped through each window and door, no matter how firmly shut it was. It filled the hallways, the living room, the bedroom and even the throne room where King Jon Snow welcomed his guests.

King Jon Snow. Sansa still couldn’t get used to the sound of it, to how the words tasted on her tongue, to everyone screaming the phrase on the top of their longs.

He deserved the title. He deserved it after what he had done for the North and after what he had done for Westeros. When someone dared to even think that Jon Snow had not worked hard enough to claim the throne, Sansa was the first to protest, to order Arya to take care of the matter before she would do so herself.

And Arya was always happy to oblige.

But Sansa also worried about Jon, carrying the weight of ruling on his shoulders and the weight of the crown on his head. The frown on his forehead deepened each day. The smile on his face faded each night. And sometimes Sansa missed the bastard he had once been, long before Ned Stark had lost his head in a dangerous game of chess with the ruling Lannisters, long before Robb Stark had led an army sound to avenge his father and had lost his life in the process, long before Jon lost whatever innocence he had once had.

“Jon?” Sansa reached for Jon’s hand and lead him to the giant window. The courtyard was covered in a thick layer of snow and more and more snowflakes were dangling to the ground to accompany the million others slowly melting there.

“Yes?” Jon turned his face towards her. Not too long ago she had been capable of making his worries disappear, of thawing his heart, of relaxing his brain. But now not even looking at her could ease the constant tension he was carrying around.

“I want to build a snowman.” Sansa curled her lips up into a slight smile. “Just like in all those stories.”

“You read too much, Sansa.” Jon shook his head, but a slight smile spread across his face. “You will freeze to death.”

Sansa reached for Jon’s hands and squeezed them firmly. “You can keep me warm.” She pulled him a little closer towards her. “I know you’re a king now, with responsibilities and boring meetings to attend, but do me this one favor. One favor and I will leave you be for the upcoming months.”

Jon let out a deep sigh, but then he gestured for the warm cloak Sansa had once made him. “If your lips turn blue…”

“Just kiss them.” Sansa interrupted him and pulled him towards the door. “We’re Starks. We’re made for this. We’re supposed to carry crowns of melting snowflakes in our hair.”

“I’m glad at least one of us is still dreaming these days.”

And sometimes Sansa missed the bastard he had once been, long before Ned Stark had lost his head in a dangerous game of chess with the ruling Lannisters, long before Robb Stark had led an army sound to avenge his father and had lost his life in the process, long before Jon lost whatever innocence he had once had.

“Jon?” Sansa reached for Jon’s hand and lead him to the giant window. The courtyard was covered in a thick layer of snow and more and more snowflakes were dangling to the ground to accompany the million others slowly melting there.

“Yes?” Jon turned his face towards her. Not too long ago she had been capable of making his worries disappear, of thawing his heart, of relaxing his brain. But now not even looking at her could ease the constant tension he was carrying around.

“I want to build a snowman.” Sansa curled her lips up into a slight smile. “Just like in all those stories.”

“You read too much, Sansa.” Jon shook his head, but a slight smile spread across his face. “You will freeze to death.”

Sansa reached for Jon’s hands and squeezed them firmly. “You can keep me warm.” She pulled him a little closer towards her. “I know you’re a king now, with responsibilities and boring meetings to attend, but do me this one favor. One favor and I will leave you be for the upcoming months.”

Jon let out a deep sigh, but then he gestured for the warm cloak Sansa had once made him. “If your lips turn blue…”

“Just kiss them.” Sansa interrupted him and pulled him towards the door. “We’re Starks. We’re made for this. We’re supposed to carry crowns of melting snowflakes in our hair.”

“I’m glad at least one of us is still dreaming these days.”
trail.content:
Written for @jonsadrabbles day 3: Modern AU OR Snowflakes

Jon is a king now, which means he has duties and meetings to attend. But when the snow falls, Sansa just wants to built a snowman

Canon Divergence // Canon Compliant 

The cold wind screamed when it whirled around the castle. It creeped through each window and door, no matter how firmly shut it was. It filled the hallways, the living room, the bedroom and even the throne room where King Jon Snow welcomed his guests.

King Jon Snow. Sansa still couldn’t get used to the sound of it, to how the words tasted on her tongue, to everyone screaming the phrase on the top of their longs.

He deserved the title. He deserved it after what he had done for the North and after what he had done for Westeros. When someone dared to even think that Jon Snow had not worked hard enough to claim the throne, Sansa was the first to protest, to order Arya to take care of the matter before she would do so herself.

And Arya was always happy to oblige.

But Sansa also worried about Jon, carrying the weight of ruling on his shoulders and the weight of the crown on his head. The frown on his forehead deepened each day. The smile on his face faded each night. And sometimes Sansa missed the bastard he had once been, long before Ned Stark had lost his head in a dangerous game of chess with the ruling Lannisters, long before Robb Stark had led an army sound to avenge his father and had lost his life in the process, long before Jon lost whatever innocence he had once had.

“Jon?” Sansa reached for Jon’s hand and lead him to the giant window. The courtyard was covered in a thick layer of snow and more and more snowflakes were dangling to the ground to accompany the million others slowly melting there.

“Yes?” Jon turned his face towards her. Not too long ago she had been capable of making his worries disappear, of thawing his heart, of relaxing his brain. But now not even looking at her could ease the constant tension he was carrying around.

“I want to build a snowman.” Sansa curled her lips up into a slight smile. “Just like in all those stories.”

“You read too much, Sansa.” Jon shook his head, but a slight smile spread across his face. “You will freeze to death.”

Sansa reached for Jon’s hands and squeezed them firmly. “You can keep me warm.” She pulled him a little closer towards her. “I know you’re a king now, with responsibilities and boring meetings to attend, but do me this one favor. One favor and I will leave you be for the upcoming months.”

Jon let out a deep sigh, but then he gestured for the warm cloak Sansa had once made him. “If your lips turn blue…”

“Just kiss them.” Sansa interrupted him and pulled him towards the door. “We’re Starks. We’re made for this. We’re supposed to carry crowns of melting snowflakes in our hair.”

“I’m glad at least one of us is still dreaming these days.”

title: Impossible
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2FAdK2x

by AryaxJaqen

Based on this silly show so Jaqen and Arya have issues to work out.
Set after the final battle. Arya is the queen. No spoilers, I’m only quoting Lena Headey ! xd
This story is inspired by James Arthur’s version of ‘Impossible.’ I heard it and I felt I wanted to torment Jaqen a little :) :) :)
It’s Jaqarya fic, sansan is only mentioned.
I own nothing. Jaqen, Arya and Sandor belong to George R. R. Martin. The song belongs to Shontelle.

summary: People love to talk about what’s canon or not canon. Well how about this; it’s canon that Jon Snow was looking at Sansa Stark’s...
body: People love to talk about what’s canon or not canon. Well how about this; it’s canon that Jon Snow was looking at Sansa Stark’s lips after he kissed her forehead on the battlements in season 6. Mind you, the parentage reveal hasn’t happened and at that point they’re supposed to still view each other as “brother and sister,” but that didn’t stop Jon and his ass was definitely looking!

if this blog were a time and place it would be CBGB's in 1977. this is a pro-cersei lannister ASOIAF blog. trying not to let the door hit my quasi-hiatus on the ass on its way out.
in september 2017 i learned that cristina kirchner's favorite character is daenerys and i'll never be the same
